Issues.Title: Incorrect display value in textbox after adding new element at top
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? I don't think so. ### Description Display value in textbox is incorrect while adding a new element in my array at the beginning. For example, if I have a list of username textbox and a button to add new username, it works if the newly added element is at the end of list. But if new element is pushed to top, it corrupts "display value" of previous top element. However the model itself is not affected. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://angular-96prby.stackblitz.io ## üî• Exception or Error NA ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

    "@angular/common": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/compiler": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/core": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/forms": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/router": "^7.0.1",
    "core-js": "^2.5.7",
    "rxjs": "^6.3.3",
    "zone.js": "^0.8.26",
Able to reproduce on chrome, safari and FF.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect display value in textbox after adding new element at top" (#28361)

Issues.Title: perf: yarn support version incremented up to 1.13.x (the latest version)
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?
yarn support version incremented up to 1.13.x (the latest version). It's package config update which was blocking the development because unavailability of yarn old versions. Also, old version of yarn are not available, and it is stopping local setups.  By this PR, the yarn package version will be support the latest yarn, and it will not block the dev to setup angular repo in local machines.

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
Currently if someone tries to setup the angular repo in local machines with latest version of yarn, the `yarn` command will failed because we are not supporting the yarn recent version. It is difficult to install the old versions of yarn which is not officially supported. So, the development will be getting blocked.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
The yarn support version has been upgraded. And so, `yarn` and related setups will not block a dev to build and run the local repo in their machine.

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): add @npm//tslib dep to e2e ts_library target in bazel-workspace schematic
Issues.Body:
`@npm//tslib` needs to be a dep in all ts_library rules if `importHelpers` is set to true. It doesn‚Äôt need to be in the application ts_library targets since `@npm//tslib` will be a transitive dep of the angular packages and we don‚Äôt do strict type checking for npm deps.

Technically, typescript does not actually need tslib available at that point since the tslib import is not typechecked and only added at the emit step but it looks like typescript is checking that the library is there since `importHelpers` is on.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(bazel): add @npm//tslib dep to e2e ts_library target in bazel-workspace schematic" (#28358)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ngcc - recognize accessor members in ES5
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, accessor functions for getters and setters would
not be considered as class member, as their declaration is vastly
different from ES2015 syntax.

With this change, the ES5 reflection host has learned to recognize the
downleveled syntax for accessors, allowing for them to be considered as
class member once again.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): verify Host Bindings and Host Listeners before compiling them
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change we may encounter some errors (like pipes being used where they should not be used) while compiling Host Bindings and Listeners. With this update we move validation logic to the analyze phase and throw an error if something is wrong. This also aligns error messages between Ivy and VE.

This PR resolves FW-725 and FW-742.

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): support property bindings and interpolations in DebugElement
Issues.Body:
DebugElement.properties should contain a map of element
property names to element property values, with entries
for both normal property bindings and host bindings.
Many Angular core tests depend on this map being present.

This PR adds support for host property bindings, normal property
bindings, and interpolations in DebugElement.properties, which 
fixes the Angular core tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " feat(ivy): support property bindings and interpolations in DebugElement" (#28355)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): TestBed should tolerate synchronous use of `compileComponents`
Issues.Body:
TestBed.compileComponents has always been an async API. However,
ViewEngine tolerated using this API in a synchronous manner if the
components declared in the testing module did not have any async
resources (templateUrl, styleUrls). This change makes the ivy TestBed
mirror this tolerance by configuring such components synchronously.

Ref: FW-992
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): TestBed should tolerate synchronous use of `compileComponents`" (#28350)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): Bazel-workspace schematics should run in ScopedTree
Issues.Body:
Users should be able to add Bazel workspace to an existing project.
The current approach assumes that the schematics is working on the
same tree as that of ng-new, which includes the top-level directory.
Instead, the schematic should work on the tree rooted at appRoot to
enable Bazel files to be added to existing project.

This change makes use of the newly implemented ScopedTree APIs
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/a0ac4b0e3dd60c75e1edafd6bb8cced47d10a8d3
to achieve this.

Issues.Title: routerLink directive always makes element focusable
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Description Issue https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/10895 requests that the `routerLink`-directive should automatically add `tabindex` on the target element if not already present (implemented via https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/13094). I understand that this behavior might be convinient in some cases, but it should still be configurable. For example, in order to implement a custom menu widget it's a good practice that the focus always stays on the surrounding element (e.g. `
`) while the user selects the target menu item with the arrow keys. Right now, implementing this in a clean and straight-forward way is not possible due to the feature implemented in the issue above. If `` is used for the menu entries, the `href` injected by `routeLink` makes it focusable and even if `` is used instead, `routeLink` still injects a `tabindex=0` to always make it focusable. When the user then clicks on a link the surrounding `
` element looses its focus as focus moves to the link that has been clicked instead. Even setting `tabindex="-1"` only prevents tabbing to the link but still allows focus via mouse click. There should either be a configuration parameter to prevent setting of `tabindex` or the feature should be reverted as `tabindex` can always be configured manually if necessary. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-qudebd ```html
  1. Bikes
  2. Cars
``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 6.2.9
Node: 8.11.3
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 6.1.10
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.8.9
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.8.9
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.8.9
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.8.9
@angular-devkit/core              0.8.9
@angular-devkit/schematics        0.8.9
@angular/cli                      6.2.9
@ngtools/webpack                  6.2.9
@schematics/angular               0.8.9
@schematics/update                0.8.9
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        2.9.2
webpack                           4.16.4
**Anything else relevant?** This can be reproduced as described in Chrome v71.0.3578.98. In Safari the focus is only lost on the second link (i.e. where `` is used).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "routerLink directive always makes element focusable" (#28345)

## What is the current behavior?
```
fix(bazel): also pass afterDeclarations transformers to emitWithTsickle

    Tsickle supports afterDeclarations transformers, but these were not being passed in.

refactor(compiler-cli): refactor import adding logic into helper

    This logic will be common to transforms that add imports. Using it as a helper helps reduce duplication

refactor(compiler-cli): use a transformer for dts files

    The current DtsFileTransformer works by intercepting file writes and editing the source string directly.

    This PR refactors it as a afterDeclaration transform in order to fit better in the TypeScript API.

    This is part of a greater effort of converting ngtsc to be usable as a TS transform plugin.
```

Issues.Title: Angular bindings not working with webcomponent built with @angular/elements
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Issue might be caused by @angular/elements or @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When using WebComponents built with @angular/elements within an angular app, data binding is not working properly. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction You can reproduced the bug by cloning the following repository: [link](https://github.com/chainlist/test-elements) Simply, run `yarn start` and test it out. You can check the difference between angular and non-angular part within the index.html ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.2.2
Node: 9.8.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.2
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.2
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.2
@schematics/angular               7.2.2
@schematics/update                0.12.2
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.28.4
**Anything else relevant?** You can find sources of the compiled element.js file inside the directory `elements-src` in the repository. FYI: It seems the bindings itself are parsed correctly because the DOM instance has the property correctly set to the App instance property, but the Angular instance of the WebComponent is not receiving the data. I don't know if I am really clear on that. Don't hesitate to ask for more info.

Issues.Title: Custom context support for else block
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
I'd like to pass a custom context to the `else` template block in `*ngIfElse` because if I have a template that's in anothe block of code I'm forced to duplicate the block with the ngIf condition to display two different templates with different contents


### Describe the solution you'd like
It could be nice to add another parameter to the ngIfElse, like `*ngIf="condition; else myTemplate; elseContext: {$implicit: element}"`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
A current workaround is to use an ngSwitch or duplicate the ngIf with reversed condition
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom context support for else block" (#28336)

Issues.Title: docs-infra: scroll position restoration improvements
Issues.Body:
Scroll position restoration was added to the angular.io app in #28037.
Here are some possible improvements to consider: 

- [ ] Add throttling/debouncing in storing scroll position on scroll [here][1], since it is relatively expensive and the `scroll` event can be emitted several times per second. See, also, [this comment][2].
- [ ] Document under what circumstances checking for manual scroll restoration support [here][3] may throw.
- [ ] Scroll the scroll position retrieved from history state in `sessionStorage` [here][4], to avoid a race-condition with navigating forward/back and immediately reloading. See, also, [this comment][5].
- [ ] Remove unnecessary(?) `try/catch` block [here][6]. See, also, [this comment][7].

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/bf6bc41043203502534607ecbbe1a4c526f8e346/aio/src/app/app.component.ts#L343
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28037/files#r250354376.
[3]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/bf6bc41043203502534607ecbbe1a4c526f8e346/aio/src/app/shared/scroll.service.ts#L49
[4]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/bf6bc41043203502534607ecbbe1a4c526f8e346/aio/src/app/shared/scroll.service.ts#L69
[5]: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28037#discussion_r249507542
[6]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/bf6bc41043203502534607ecbbe1a4c526f8e346/aio/src/app/shared/scroll.service.ts#L48-L53
[7]: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28037#discussion_r250527791
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-infra: scroll position restoration improvements" (#28332)

Issues.Title: CSS calculations do not work for inline animation delay on production build
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? It wasn't working on 7.0.7 either. Below that, I do not know. ### Description When running `ng build --prod` (without the --prod tag it's working fine), css calculations cannot be used for the inline css animation delay, such as: `animation: animationName 0.2s calc(0.04s * 3) 1 linear backwards;` or `animation: animationName 0.2s (0.04s * 3) 1 linear backwards;` If using any of these , the whole line is just ignored and doesn't even appear in the css file that results from the build --prod command. Setting the delay separately (`animation-delay: calc(0.04s * 3)`) works. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction @keyframes firstRowsAppear { 0% { transform: translateY(-50px) scale(0.8, 0); } } some-element { display: flex; margin-top: 8px; animation: firstRowsAppear 0.3s calc(0.04s * 2) linear 1 backwards; // This works: // animation: firstRowsAppear 0.3s 0s linear 1 backwards; // animation-delay: calc(0.04s * 2); } ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 7.2.3
Node: 11.2.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: Add relevant css lint to generated project
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When running the command `ng new example-project` the user is prompted to select a css framework type. This is added to your project and you can quickly start development. However it does not add any quality standards/tests for css, scss, sass, less. This means either a project doesn't have consistent css standards or they have to be manually added later.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Automatically add the relevant css linting tool to the package.json

- https://www.npmjs.com/package/csslint
- https://www.npmjs.com/package/sass-lint
- https://www.npmjs.com/package/lesshint

And of course add the relevant command to package.json e.g.
```
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve",
    "build": "ng build",
    "test": "ng test",
    "lint": "ng lint && sass-lint",
    "e2e": "ng e2e"
  },
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Manually installing the library for every new project, or ensuring every developer has it installed in their Code Editor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add relevant css lint to generated project" (#13502)

Issues.Title: Feature: Add a way to output lint result to a file
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
ng lint --format=json > issues.json
Worked previously as describe here:  [#4959](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4959)
Worked for outputting results to json or any format.

In Angular 7 there was the addition of color to the output of lint results. This has broken the above workaround for outputting to a file.

what was previously like:
```
[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/app/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
]
```

is now like so

```
[37m[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/spp/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
][39m
```


### Solution I would like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I would like an option added to ng lint to output to a file easily


### Workaround
"ng lint --format=json | sed -r \\"s/\\\x1B\\\[([0-9]{1,2}(;[0-9]{1,2})?)?[mGK]//g\\" > issues.json"
Which is ugly but works

Issues.Title: Ability to configure output path for source maps
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
**Ability to configure output path for source maps**

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When I create a production build using `ng build -prod --sourcemaps`,
I would like the ability to configure the output path for the source map files,
So that my source maps will not be deployed with my application.

### Describe the solution you'd like
A dedicated --source-map-output-path build command to configure the output path of the source maps only.

The output of the build should continue to go to --output-path=./dist
The source maps should go to the path specified by --source-map-output-path

### Describe alternatives you've considered
The current solution is a post-build script that moves the *.map files from the --output-path=./dist directory into a different target directory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ability to configure output path for source maps" (#13508)

Issues.Title: ng-add easy support for libraries
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

It is very common that when we generate a library, we want to add `ng-add` support, and it is tedious to have to configure it (in addition, __there is no or I have not found documentation__ to carry out the process).

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add a flag `--ng-add` to generate a library with a schematics project (with collection.json) and a default scehamtic `ng-add`.

__Example:__

`ng generate library <lib-name> --ng-add` : it generates a new library with a configuration described in __Describe the solution you'd like__

### Describe alternatives you've considered

If this is not possible, add a __step-by-step guide__ explaining how to configure it to the official documentation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng-add easy support for libraries" (#13505)

Issues.Body:
If using `strictFunctionTypes: true` in `tsconfig.json`, the default e2e test introduced in `7.3.0-beta.0` is failing compilation with:

```
error TS2345: Argument of type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to parameter of type 'Expected<Entry>'.
  Type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'ObjectContaining<Entry>'.
    Type 'Partial<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'Partial<Entry>'.
     Type '{ level: Level; }' is not assignable to type 'Entry'.
```

Explictely using `as logging.Entry` fixes the issue.

Issues.Title: mat-expansion-panel re-renders (n + n^2) times when used with *ngFor (OnPush)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-expansion-panel inside *ngFor loop renders as many times as there are iterations in the loop.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-expansion-panel re-renders (n + n^2) times where n is the number of iterations in the loop.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nxejpq?file=app%2Fexpansion-overview-example.ts

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
7.2.1, Chrome 71.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This bug makes expansion panel with a large (~100) amount of items (or subitems) practically unusable in the default (with animations) mode.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-expansion-panel re-renders (n + n^2) times when used with *ngFor (OnPush)" (#14953)

Issues.Title: mat-expansion-panel re-renders multiple times in a very simple case (no animation, OnPush).
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-expansion-panel updates (renders) exactly once when there is no reason to do it multiple times.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-expansion-panel renders at least 2 times ([@.disabled]="true"+ ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush)
or even more times if animation is enabled (default) and change detection mode is Default.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rj4nhe?file=app%2Fexpansion-overview-example.ts

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
7.2.1, Chrome 71

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It is very important not to have "unexpected" behavior (multiple rendering) because it affects performance metrics. If multiple rendering is "expected" I would suggest to mention about it in docs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-expansion-panel re-renders multiple times in a very simple case (no animation, OnPush)." (#14952)

Issues.Title: feat(expansion-panel): allow expansion panel header to be associated ‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶with a role other than button

Add `headerRole`, `toggleAriaLabel` and `toggleAriaLabelledBy` inputs for expansion panel header. This allows expansion panel header to be associated with a role other than `"button"` so that interactive elements such as buttons could be added inside the header. When the expansion panel header does not have a role of `"button"`, the toggle element will get a role of button, as well as aria attributes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(expansion-panel): allow expansion panel header to be associated ‚Ä¶" (#14951)

Issues.Title: mat-slide-toggle add option to behave as an ARIA toggle button rather than a checkbox
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
mat-slide-toggle should expose an input that causes it to present button and aria-pressed semantics rather than checkbox and aria-checked.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
The ARIA implementation of mat-checkbox and mat-button-toggle are great. mat-checkbox is a standard checkbox with aria-checked. mat-button-toggle is a standard button with aria-pressed. The usage guidelines are pretty clear: use checkbox when the change is pending form submission and toggle button when the change is effective immediately.

mat-slide-toggle sits in the middle ground in terms of apparent semantics and can plausibly be used in both situations. Currently it only presents as a checkbox. Maybe we could keep this as a default option and add an input that uses button with aria-pressed semantics.

WAI guidelines for toggle buttons: https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#button

> Toggle button: A two-state button that can be either off (not pressed) or on (pressed). To tell assistive technologies that a button is a toggle button, specify a value for the attribute aria-pressed. For example, a button labeled mute in an audio player could indicate that sound is muted by setting the pressed state true. Important: it is critical the label on a toggle does not change when its state changes. In this example, when the pressed state is true, the label remains "Mute" so a screen reader would say something like "Mute toggle button pressed". Alternatively, if the design were to call for the button label to change from "Mute" to "Unmute," the aria-pressed attribute would not be needed.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I looked at google3 examples of mat-slide-toggle especially in Cloud Console, and it's pretty split down the middle whether it's a part of a form or effectively a button with immediate action.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-slide-toggle add option to behave as an ARIA toggle button rather than a checkbox" (#14949)

Issues.Title: [mat-table][a11y] Ability to add caption to mat-table.
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
It would be nice to have an opportunity to add [caption](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/caption) tag to mat-table. 

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
An accessible name for a table enables people using SR to identify the purpose of the table and to differentiate among multiple data tables on the same page or match the table with another data.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Alternatively we can use aria-label but it's not supported as widely as caption
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-table][a11y] Ability to add caption to mat-table." (#14948)

Issues.Title: feat(dialog): add ariaLabelledBy config option
Issues.Body:
This change adds the ability to manually set the `aria-labelledby` attribute of a `MatDialog`. 

Users can set the `aria-labelledby` without the `mat-dialog-title` directive.  Users can provide multiple id's. 

It is described as an attribute of `MatDialogConfig` in the [Dialog Accessibility Documentation](https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview#accessibility), but is not implemented.  This was also mentioned as a follow up to #5176 ([comment](https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/5178#pullrequestreview-44701318)).

No breaking changes.  Existing functionality is preserved without setting the `ariaLabelledBy` config attribute.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(dialog): add ariaLabelledBy config option" (#14943)

Issues.Title: Drag and Drop in nested DropLists
Issues.Body:
I've got a problem with the Drag and Drop Feature. I'm trying to use nested DropLists which can be nested arbitrary deep. It is not possible to drag items into the third level of the DropLists.
In addition to this the items jump back and forth when dragging from the first to the second level.

The workaround from [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53271834/nested-drag-and-drop-in-with-angular-7-material-cdk) fixed the issue with the jumping items from the first to levels. But it doesn't fix the issue of dropping items into the third layer.

I've coded a minimal and a more complex example to show the problems.

[Code](https://stackblitz.com/edit/draganddropexample)

In the complex example removing the items from the DropLists doesn't work (seems to be a problem with the model not refreshing the UI, so nevermind. I'm trying to fix it soon.). The complex example includes more encapsulated components. The simple one is just two components that are handling the Drag and Drop. The simple example includes the workaround mentioned above, which fixes the jumping between the first and the second level. 

I expect, when dragging the _2_ in the simple example to the drop-area of _Composite 1.1_ (between _Leaf 1.1.1_ and _Leaf 1.1.2_), the item to drop into _Composite 1.1_. But this does not happen. In addition to that the item jumps back and forth, when its over the _Composite 1.1_ box. Maybe someone has an idea how to fix this...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and Drop in nested DropLists" (#14939)

Issues.Title: Datepicker: scroll page enable on iOS
Issues.Body:
When the Datepicker is open on iOS devices with Safari, users can still scroll the web page. This behavior is not permitted on other browsers for desktops and android devices.

It seems that the CSS property pointer-events used on the element with the class cdk-overlay-backdrop is not working in this environment.

I am using Angular 7 and it has been behaving this way since I have been using that feature a year ago. So, this is not version related.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Datepicker: scroll page enable on iOS" (#14938)

Issues.Title: JAWS (18.0.5038) loses "forms mode" for legacy mat-form-field with floatLabel="never"
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
JAWS should be able to retain "Forms mode" (ignore jaws shortcuts) when typing in an input-field.

#### What is the current behavior?
After typing a letter (causing the label to go invisible) in a text input field JAWS is thrown out of "forms mode" (indicated by a pop sound). This happens for mat-form-fields with legacy appearance with the floatLabel-input set to "never"

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
- use JAWS screen reader
- Navigate to form field with tab or keyboard arrows (the form field should have the input floatLabel set to "never")
- Listen for the "pop" sound that indicates JAWS is now in forms mode (when forms mode is set to AUTO)
- type a letter
- be sad when JAWS shortcuts get triggered when you try to type 

https://jaws-forms-mode-mat-form-field.stackblitz.io/


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
reproduced in
Angular: 7.0.1 and 7.2.0
Material: 7.0.2 and 7.2.0
Typescript: 3.2.2
Chrome 71 and JAWS (18.0.5038)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "JAWS (18.0.5038) loses "forms mode" for legacy mat-form-field with floatLabel="never"" (#14927)

Issues.Title: [Menu] Cannot pass from one menu to another
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When creating a menu inside a toolbar when clicking on the first item (a button that open a menu) i would except the second menu to open when the mouse enter the next menu item in the toolbar.

#### What is the current behavior?
You need to click on the second item of the menu to open the second menu. This is totally logical, because root menu items are simple button, but if you try to create a complex menu toolbar, users are used to menu that open automatically without the need to click (apart from the first time)

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
you can look here for the kind of menu that i mean : https://stackblitz.com/edit/dynamic-nested-topnav-menu?file=app%2Fapp.component.html
if you click on the first item ('DevFestFL') and them move your mouse on "Didney" or "Orlando" you would except, as a user, that the corresponding menu open automatically. Instead, you need to click on the item.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
"@angular/animations": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/cdk": "~7.2.1",
"@angular/common": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/compiler": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/core": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/forms": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/material": "^7.2.1",
"@angular/platform-browser": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/router": "~7.2.0",
"core-js": "^2.5.4",
"hammerjs": "^2.0.8",
"rxjs": "~6.3.3",
"tslib": "^1.9.0",
"zone.js": "~0.8.26"
```

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I understand why this is happening and it seems that we would need to have something like a `mat-menu-toolbar` that could automatically 'open' a mat-menu-item and show it to the user (horizontally or vertically) like that we could have a coherent way of showing simple menu and complex one without so much effort.

thanks !
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Menu] Cannot pass from one menu to another" (#14924)
